column4: evms crashes my system 5 times a day.  Is evms in dapper more stable?  would it make sense to just upgrade to a dapper kernel?
Or can I disable evms completely in breezy somehow?
how is evms crashing your machine?
By sucking I guess, I don't know
the implication of my question being "that is pretty unlikely" on the grounds that evms is entirely userspace
Otherwise it wouldn't require a kernel patch to use
last I saw of it they removed them and rewrote it to use the existing device-mapper kernel components
Okay... did they do that before or after the 2.6.12 in Breezy?
I'm asking how you know it's evms doing it and not something else, basically
I don't know, of course.  But the last 30 times my system has crashed, evms has had the last entry in the system logs.
It will sit there quiet and nice for hours, and then the second it starts doing anything the system goes down.
I can post the logs if that would be helpful.  I don't actually know what evms does really, or why it would crash a machine.  The log files look pretty suspicious, though.
posting logs sounds like a good idea
unfortunately I have to go, but I see no mention of evms in the ubuntu kernel patch for 2.6.12
Can you give me an URL for that log?
